nodes.bodyText: while you are refactoring the code, you can move this check to beforeAll
Based on our discussion in slack, this is not needed.

We shouldn't be marking this as a Test method. The real test is whether we can create/start a domain in PV using WDT tool. This should simply be a assertion. Please make this as a private method and call it inside the test method or move it to common test utils if possible.

If the actual test is verifying the domain can be created/started using domain in PV and WDT. It should only have the checks to make sure the domain is created/started IMO. If I make this as an assertion in the same domain creation test, if this assertion fails for some reason, it will mark the domain creation test as failed which is actually not correct.

IMO - its setup, verify (single test)
This method  testDeployAppUsingT3ChannelPort can be used in any IT class, one may may fail and other may pass depending on the domain setup/startup.
That's what we used in JUnit4 as well.

domain could have been created/started successfully, but application deployment may fail, they are two different tests. For example, we have seen UnknownHostException while deploying the application even though the domain is created/started, in that case it will mark domain creation test also as failed.
moved app deployment to the actual test and leaving other use cases in individual tests..waiting for jenkins results..
This should be discouraged.
If the tests have dependencies or ordered tests, with out this logic, it will run the other tests even if the first test fails and they take time to execute and eventually fail.
Yes that is one of the reason I am hesitant to move the deploy assertions out of test method.
not just in this test, this applies for all tests where there are dependencies, we have such tests in new/JUnit5 tests. Why do we want execute a test when its prerequisites have not met?
The prerequisites  like domain creation and startup are asserted, so if prerequisites are not met this is not going to get executed.

I mean if test1(lets say domain creation) is prerequisite to test2(testing some feature like load balancing in this test) then we don't want to run test2 if test1 fails. In such cases, we need this logic.
The application is not accessed after deployment for this domain.
for that load balancer is needed, then we have move everything into one test.

               * Verify liveness probe by killing managed server process 3 times to kick
          
          
            
               * Verify liveness probe by killing managed server process 3 times to kickoff
After pod restart we have to make sure the deployed applications can continue to be accessed. Please add a check for it.
This test is only to verify liveness probe is working.
will be adding a check
You don't need a method order for this method?
no, wdt test will be the first one to run in this class, after that any order is fine for this test as the domain will be up and running.
I will add the order if that makes it more clear
